active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a Zero Trust environment, how does microsegmentation mitigate east-west traffic risks compared to traditional perimeter defenses? Debate the trade-offs in complexity versus security gains, addressing common misconceptions like equating microsegmentation to simple VLANs.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Microsegmentation' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity (Level 1) > 004_Network and Infrastructure Security (Level 2) > Network Isolation and Segmentation (Entry Subdomain, Level 3) > Microsegmentation (Level 6)). Position as key network isolation technique building on VLANs/firewalls, enhancing Zero Trust by granular control of east-west traffic to reduce lateral movement (sources: CISA.gov ZT-Microsegmentation-Guidance, PaloAltoNetworks.com, ResearchGate.net). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [REMEMBER: Define...; UNDERSTAND: Explain...; etc.] Distribute flashcards across all 6 levels. - Active Learning: Tie cards to discussion (Zero Trust vs. perimeter trade-offs), peer teaching (PEPs examples), problem-solving (breached DB scenario). - Scaffolding: Layer 1 (Foundation: terms like east-west traffic); Layer 2 (Components: PEPs/policies); Layer 3 (Implementation: assess/deploy/monitor); Layer 4 (Integration: NIST/Zero Trust). Use Flashcard Schema: - Output as JSON array of 50 objects: {'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '... (cite sources, link to objectives/layers/activities)', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'distractors': [...]}}. - 60% Q&A/definition/open-ended; 40% MCQ with 4 options (1 correct). - Distractors: Plausible misconceptions (e.g., 'VLANs provide microsegmentation' - no, lacks granularity). - Ensure progressive difficulty: 20% Layer1/Remember, increasing to Layer4/Create. - Make engaging, accurate, complete (e.g., PEPs at host/network levels).
